Prerequisites: STUDENTS WILL NEED TO COMPLETE THE PRINCIPLES OF ACCOUNTING I AND II AND THE INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING I
Course Description: THIS COURSE IS THE SECOND HALF OF TWO SERIES OF COURSES THAT PROVIDES A SYSTEMATIC AND IN-DEPTH STUDY OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND UNDERLYING RECORDS. SPECIAL ATTENTION IS GIVEN TO THE ELEMENTS COMPOSING WORKING CAPITAL, INVESTMENTS AND ASSETS
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, THE STUDENT WILL BE ABLE TO:
 
1. BE ABLE TO PREPARE, UNDERSTAND AND ANALYZE FINANCIAL REPORTING STATEMENTS
2. BE ABLE TO UNDERSTAND AND ANALYZE BUSINESS OPERATIONAL ACTIVITIES WITH RESPECT TO:
A) CASH FLOWS
B) RECEIVABLES
C) INVENTORIES
D) LIABILITIES AND CONTINGENT ACTIVITIES
3) UNDERSTAND BASIC BUSINESS INVESTMENT ACTIVITIES:
A)PROPERTY, PLANTS AND EQUIPMENT
B) DEPRECIATION, DEPLETION AND DISPOSAL
C)INTANGIBLES
D) INVESTMENTS
E) LONG TERM RECEIVALBLES
Textbook(s):
INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING: REPORTING AND ANALYSIS, 2ND EDITION 
JAMES M. WAHLEN INDIANA UNIVERSITY 
JEFFERSON P. JONES AUBURN UNIVERSITY
